description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5g79","text":"This is a step by step protocol for assembling invertebrate mitochondrial genomes, annotating the genomes , publishing the genomes and then step by step protocol for making a phylogenetic tree using the data from the mitochondrial genomes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"eijrt","text":"I have used the protocol, and it has worked for me, however I am not guaranteeing that this protocol will work.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it has worked for us in the past.

steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"friab","text":"After QC, we ran our illumina short reads through a program called Novoplasty v.4.3.1. for mitochondrial genome assembly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4huc7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"sc32","text":"Next you want to upload a seed and a reference file. The seed is where you would want the assembler to start assembling the program. I used the COI of an already published mitochondrial genome. Next you will want to upload the reference genome. I used the already published mitochondrial genome of the sea spider Achelia bituberculata. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36usj","text":"Then you want to create a config.txt file for your assembly.  It should loo like this:
